post.content:
Re 1: Let's learn servlet with tomca Let's study servlet with tutorial on http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/servlets/index.html http://www.javastudy.co.kr if you want korean.
여러분중에 이 AddressBook숙제를 Servlet을 UI로 구성하고, Java Object을 연동해서 구현할 분을 위해서 Template로 사용할 Servlet을 여기에 동봉합니다. AddressBook application 을 위한 class들을 먼저 디자인하고 그리고 그 위에 UI로 저의 template servlet을 수정하여 구성하여 보세요.
http://webhome.idirect.com/~scottl/java/AddressBook/AddressBookServ.java
Servlet에 내부에 Business logic session object과 entity object을 넣는다면 후일 Reusability가 별로 안좋겠지요. ??
Servlet에 관한 상세한 내용을 알고싶고 개발환경을 갖추고 싶다면....
For the 1st assignment.
If you want to build my assingment using Servlet or JSP, you may download the "Tomcat 3.2.1"from java.sun.com as below
http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/archive.html
Or you can implement it with Swing..
<< if you like to do with servlet >>
Servlet guide
1. study servlet - understand basic concept from
http://www.apl.jhu.edu/~hall/java/Servlet-Tutorial/
======= please ignore below step, I will post new step to 1. install and run JSP/Servlet on Tomcat, access overview on http://java.sun.com/products/jsp/tomcat/
2. download tomcat 3.2.1 from
http://jakarta.apache.org/builds/jakarta-tomcat/release/v3.2.1/bin/ download "jakarta-tomcat-3.2.1.zip " and unzip to your PC. You may unzip this to c:\unzipped\jacarta-tomcat-3.2.1 directory as default. After unzip, copy it to new directory (c:\tomcat example) for easy name.
3. go to 'c:\tomcat\bin' on DOS prompt and type 'startup' You will see extra DOS window open. 4. open your browser and type this url "http://localhost:8080/" It will give you tomcat index.html and you will see all samples for JSP and servlet. Click any of them to see running
5. You can use 'http://localhost:8080/examples/servlets/' to go servlet samples and run a sample servlet 'http://localhost:8080/examples/servlet/RequestParamExample'
6. then you will see how to work. Go back to your directory c:\jsp\examples\servlets you will see Java sample codes.
7. Apply a right one for your homework.
There are many Servlet books in bookstore if you want to buy. But not necessary if you are satisfied with java.sun.com's tutorial.
Now, your Tomcat is running OK. Next, test Scott's AddressBookServlet. << HOw to test Scott's servlet on your PC >> 1. Tomcat has 'examples' directory to contain sample codes. go to the directory cd c:\tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\classes and create new directory 'address' and 'frame'
2. download new source code from Scott's Java site http://webhome.idirect.com/~scottl/java/AddressBook/
3. download the AddressBookServ.java to c:\tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\classes
4. download the ListDB.java to c:\tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\classes\frame
5. download the AddressBook.java, AddressBookTester.java, Person.java to c:\tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\classes\address
6. You need to compile those five files on your machine. Your classpath should include 'tools.jar' to compile servlet. For more detail, please check the readme.txt file in tomcat\docs directory.
go to c:\tomcat\webapps\examples\WEB-INF\classes\ type ' javac frame\*.java' type ' javac address\*.java' type ' javac AddressBookServ.java'
7. Then at DOS prompt, type' shutdown' to stop server and 'startup' to start tomcat server
8. Open browser and type 'http://localhost:8080/examples/servlet/AddressBookServ'
Then you will see the sample application..
